column4: anyone: I installed Enlightenment windowmangager... then decided it looks like too much work. Now I want to as (sheepishly) for instruction to switch the gnome window manager back on. Can anyone help?
k
do you still get gdm (the login manager) when you restart X?
as in does it ask me to log in? no... but it never did.
are you on ubuntu at all?
I dont really know where to draw the line between a dist and a window manager...  I can get the ubuntu interface up by running "exec gnome-session"
but while im runnning e, i cant see any of the files which are regularly on my desktop
how do you start X when you boot?
sorry but what is X?
the GUI server that controls your graphics card -- the layer under the window manager.
have you got the ubuntu-desktop package installed?
yes. I installed E by choosing the package in package-manager
when you boot your computer, what's the first thing you get to type into? (It should normally be a login screen)
I must have disabled the login screen a while ago becuase i never had that even when I did have the ubuntu-desck top showing. now I just see the enlightenment desktop
can you do a 'sudo update-rc.d gdm defaults', then close all applications and hit Ctrl-Alt-Backspace
ok that time I got a ubuntu login...
at the login screen, you should be able to select a standard gnome session, with metacity as the wm
ok that time I got a ubuntu login...
ubuntu uses metacity?
yes
wow, Cheers!
gnome uses metacity?
thanks you so much
pleasure
